tn.text: After Jesus calms the great storm, he heals a man who has many demons, but the local people in Gerasa are not glad about his healing, and they beg Jesus to leave.
The word "They" refers to Jesus and his disciples.
This refers to the Sea of Galilee.
This name refers to the people who live in Gerasa. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

This is an idiom meaning that the man is "controlled" or "possessed" by the unclean spirit. AT: "controlled by an unclean spirit" or "that an unclean spirit possessed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: He had been bound many times
tn.text: This can be written in active form. AT: "People had bound him many times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be written in active form. AT: "shattered his shackles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"bonds on his feet" or "metal bindings attached to his ankles to confine him"
"handcuffs" or "chains attached to his wrists to confine him"

tn.ref: No one had the strength to subdue him
tn.text: The man was so strong that no one could subdue him. AT: "He was so strong that no one was strong enough to subdue him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"control him"
Often times when a person is possessed by a demon, the demon will cause the person to do self-destructive things, such as cutting himself.

tn.ref: When he saw Jesus from a distance
tn.text: When the man first saw Jesus, Jesus would have been getting out of the boat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that he knelt down before Jesus out of reverence and respect, not out of worship.
The UDB uses a verse bridge to combine these two verses in order to write the events in the order that they occurred. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]])
"The unclean spirit cried out"

tn.ref: What do I have to do with you, Jesus, Son of the Most High God?
tn.text: The unclean spirit asks this question out of fear. This can be written as a statement. AT: "Leave me alone, Jesus, Son of the Most High God! There is no reason for you to interfere with me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Jesus has the power to torment unclean spirits.

tn.ref: Son of the Most High God
tn.text: This is an important title for Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: I beg you by God himself
tn.text: Here the unclean spirit is swearing by God as he makes a request of Jesus. Consider how this type of request is made in your language. AT: "I beg you before God" or "I swear by God himself and beg you"
"And Jesus asked the unclean spirit"

tn.ref: And he answered him, "My name is Legion, for we are many"
tn.text: One spirit was speaking for many here. He spoke of them as if they were a legion, a Roman army unit of about 6,000 soldiers. AT: "And the spirit said to him, 'Call us an army, for many of us are inside the man'" (See: [[: en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"the unclean spirits begged Jesus"
It may be helpful to state clearly what Jesus allowed them to do. AT: "Jesus allowed the unclean spirits to do what they asked for"
"and the pigs rushed"

tn.ref: into the sea, and about two thousand pigs drowned in the sea
tn.text: You can make this a separate sentence: "into the sea. There were about two thousand pigs, and they drowned in the sea"
"about 2,000 pigs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: in the city and in the countryside
tn.text: It can be stated clearly that the men gave their report to the people who were in the city and countryside. AT: "to people in the city and in the countryside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This was the name of the many demons that were in the man. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:mrk:05:09|5:9]].
This is an idiom meaning that he is thinking clearly. AT: "of a normal mind" or "thinking clearly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "they" refers to the group of people who went out to see what had happened.

tn.ref: Those who had seen what happened
tn.text: "The people who had witnessed what had happened"
possessed man** - Though the man is no longer demon-possessed, he is still described in this way. AT: "the man who had been demon-possessed"

tn.ref: But he did not allow it
tn.text: What Jesus did not allow the man to do can be stated clearly. AT: "But he did not allow the man to come with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a region that means Ten Cities. It is located to the southeast of the Sea of Galilee. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
It may be helpful to state why the people were amazed. AT: "all the people who heard what the man said were amazed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

After healing the demon-possessed man in region of the Gerasenes, Jesus and his disciples return across the lake to Capernaum where the one of the rulers of the synagogue asks Jesus to heal his daughter.
It may be helpful to add information to this phrase. AT: "the other side of the sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"on the seashore" or "on the shore"
This is the Sea of Galilee.
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"So Jesus went with Jairus." Jesus' disciples also went with him. AT: "So Jesus and the disciples went with Jairus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Laying on hands" refers to a prophet or teacher placing his hand on someone and imparting either healing or a blessing. In this case, Jarius is asking Jesus to heal his daughter.

tn.ref: that she may be made well and live
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and heal her and make her live" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This means they crowded around Jesus and pressed themselves together to be closer to Jesus.
While Jesus is on his way to heal the man's little 12-year-old girl, a woman who has been sick for 12 years interrupts by touching Jesus for her healing.
"Now" indicates that this woman is being introduced to the story. Consider how new characters are introduced into a story in your language. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])

tn.ref: whose blood had flowed for twelve years
tn.text: The woman did not have an open wound; rather, her monthly flow of blood would not stop. Your language may have a polite way to refer to this condition. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
"for 12 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"her sickness got worse" or "her bleeding increased"
She had heard reports about Jesus of how he healed people. AT: "that Jesus healed people" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
outer garment or coat
This can be stated in active form. AT: "it will heal me" or "his power will heal me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: she was healed from her affliction
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the sickness had left her" or "she was no longer sick" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: that power had gone out from him
tn.text: When the woman touched Jesus, Jesus felt his power healing her. Jesus himself did not lose any of his power to heal people when he healed her. AT: "that his healing power had healed the woman"
This means they crowded around Jesus and pressed themselves together to be closer to Jesus. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:mrk:05:21|5:24]].
"knelt down before him." She knelt down before Jesus as an act of honor and submission.
The phrase "the whole truth" refers to how she had touched him and became well. AT: "told him the whole truth about how she had touched him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Jesus was using this term figuratively to refer to the woman as a believer.
"your faith in me"
"While Jesus was speaking"

tn.ref: some people came from the leader of the synagogue
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) these people had come from Jarius' house or 2) Jairus had previously given these people orders to go see Jesus or 3) these people had been sent by the man who was presiding as the synagogue leader in Jairus' absence.
The "leader of the synagogue" is Jairus.
"saying to Jairus"

tn.ref: Why trouble the teacher any longer?
tn.text: This question can be written as a statement. AT: "It is useless to bother the teacher any longer." or "There no need to bother the teacher any longer." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This refers to Jesus.
The UDB uses a verse bridge to combine verses 37 and 38. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_versebridge]])
If necessary, you can state what Jesus is commanding Jairus to believe. AT: "Just believe I can make you daughter live"
In these verses the word "he" refers to Jesus.
"to come with him." It may be helpful to state where they were going. AT: "to accompany him to Jairus' house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Jesus said to the people who were weeping"

tn.ref: Why are you upset and why do you weep?
tn.text: Jesus asked this question to help them see their lack of faith. This may be written as a statement. AT: "This is not a time to be upset and crying." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"sent all the other people outside the house"
This refers to Peter, James, and John.

tn.ref: went in where the child was
tn.text: It may be helpful to state where the child is. AT: "went into the room where the child was lying" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is an Aramaic sentence, which Jesus spoke to the little girl in her language. Write these words as is with your alphabet. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])

tn.ref: she was twelve years of age
tn.text: "she was 12 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: He strictly ordered them that no one should know about this
tn.text: This can be stated as a direct quote. AT: "He ordered them strictly, 'No one should know about this!'" or "He ordered them strictly, 'Do not tell anyone about what I have done!'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
"He strongly commanded them"

tn.ref: And he told them to give her something to eat
tn.text: This can be stated as a direct quote. AT: "And he told them, 'Give her something to eat.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
